descriptionNullable:
## Context Sleep is an extremely important physiological process that aids in the restoration of the body's functional systems and the maintenance of cognitive functions. One of the common sleep problems is sleep-disordered breathing (SDB), the prevalence of which increases due to various factors such as overweight and obesity, reduced physical activity, and others. SDB can lead to serious cardiovascular and neurological disorders. The diagnosis of SDB requires a full polysomnography and its interpretation by specialists, making the process labor-intensive and complex, especially in the early stages when symptoms are mild. This dataset consists of readings from 40 patients: 6 channels of electroencephalography and some tabular attributes. ## Attribute Information ### patients.csv 1. **user_id** - Unique user id [Range 1-40] 2. **night_id** - Night id of the row [Range 1-2] 3. **age** - Age of the patient [Years] 4. **sex** - sex of the patient [F: Female, M: Male] 5. **height** - Height of the patient [Centimeters] 6. **weight** - Weight of the patient [Kilograms] 7. **pulse** - Pulse of the patient [Beats per minute] 8. **BPsys/BPdia** - Systolic blood pressure / diastolic blood pressure of the patient [Millimeters of mercury/Millimeters of mercury] 9. **ODI** - Oxygen desaturation index of the patient for the night. For some healthy patients will be none [Continuous range 0-...] 10. **NAp** - Number of cases apnoe of the patient for the night. For healthy patients is none [Range 0-...] 11. **NHyp** - Number of cases hyperapnoe of the patient for the night. For healthy patients is none [Range 0-...] 12. **AI** - Apnoe index of the patient for the night. Calculated by the formula: NAp / TimeOfRecordInHours. For healthy patients is none [Continuous range 0-...] 13. **HI** - Hyperapnoe index of the patient for the night. Calculated by the formula: NHyp / TimeOfRecordInHours. For healthy patients is none [Continuous range 0-...] 14. **AHI** - Apnoe-hyperapnoe index of the patient for the night. Calculated by the formula: (NAp+NHyp) / TimeOfRecordInHours. For healthy patients is none [Continuous range 0-...] ### polysomnographics/User-{user_id}-Night-{night_id}.npy 80 Records, 2 night per patient. NPY is format is the standard binary file format in NumPy for persisting a single arbitrary NumPy array on disk Each file is a two-dimensional array, with the rows representing various channels of the patient's electroencephalogram. Sampling rate for all channels is: 200 Hz Description of array: [Row number] - Information about channel
  1. Fp1-M2
  2. C3-M2
  3. O1-M2
  4. Fp2-M1
  5. C4-M1
  6. O2-M1
title: Polysomnographic sleep data
subtitle: 6 electroencephalography channels for apnoe/hyperapnoe prediction
description:
## Context Sleep is an extremely important physiological process that aids in the restoration of the body's functional systems and the maintenance of cognitive functions. One of the common sleep problems is sleep-disordered breathing (SDB), the prevalence of which increases due to various factors such as overweight and obesity, reduced physical activity, and others. SDB can lead to serious cardiovascular and neurological disorders. The diagnosis of SDB requires a full polysomnography and its interpretation by specialists, making the process labor-intensive and complex, especially in the early stages when symptoms are mild. This dataset consists of readings from 40 patients: 6 channels of electroencephalography and some tabular attributes. ## Attribute Information ### patients.csv 1. **user_id** - Unique user id [Range 1-40] 2. **night_id** - Night id of the row [Range 1-2] 3. **age** - Age of the patient [Years] 4. **sex** - sex of the patient [F: Female, M: Male] 5. **height** - Height of the patient [Centimeters] 6. **weight** - Weight of the patient [Kilograms] 7. **pulse** - Pulse of the patient [Beats per minute] 8. **BPsys/BPdia** - Systolic blood pressure / diastolic blood pressure of the patient [Millimeters of mercury/Millimeters of mercury] 9. **ODI** - Oxygen desaturation index of the patient for the night. For some healthy patients will be none [Continuous range 0-...] 10. **NAp** - Number of cases apnoe of the patient for the night. For healthy patients is none [Range 0-...] 11. **NHyp** - Number of cases hyperapnoe of the patient for the night. For healthy patients is none [Range 0-...] 12. **AI** - Apnoe index of the patient for the night. Calculated by the formula: NAp / TimeOfRecordInHours. For healthy patients is none [Continuous range 0-...] 13. **HI** - Hyperapnoe index of the patient for the night. Calculated by the formula: NHyp / TimeOfRecordInHours. For healthy patients is none [Continuous range 0-...] 14. **AHI** - Apnoe-hyperapnoe index of the patient for the night. Calculated by the formula: (NAp+NHyp) / TimeOfRecordInHours. For healthy patients is none [Continuous range 0-...] ### polysomnographics/User-{user_id}-Night-{night_id}.npy 80 Records, 2 night per patient. NPY is format is the standard binary file format in NumPy for persisting a single arbitrary NumPy array on disk Each file is a two-dimensional array, with the rows representing various channels of the patient's electroencephalogram. Sampling rate for all channels is: 200 Hz Description of array: [Row number] - Information about channel
  1. Fp1-M2
  2. C3-M2
  3. O1-M2
  4. Fp2-M1
  5. C4-M1
  6. O2-M1
